lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
PAL chatbot is a **desktop app for managing your daily tasks**,
optimized for use via a **Command Line Interface** (CLI) while
still having the benefits of a Graphical User Interface (GUI).
Shows all commands together with a short description of each command.
Adds a todo task to the list.
Got it, I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task(s) in the list.
Adds a deadline task to the list.
Got it, I've added this task:
Now you have 2 task(s) in the list.
Adds an event task to the list.
Got it, I've added this task:
Now you have 3 task(s) in the list.
Displays all the tasks that were added.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Marks the specified task as done.
- Marks the task at the specified `INDEX`
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
- The index **must be a positive integer**
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Marks the specified task as undone.
- Unmarks the task at the specified `INDEX`
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
- The index **must be a positive integer**
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
- Deletes the task at the specified `INDEX`
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
- The index **must be a positive integer**
Now you have 2 task(s) in the list.
Sorts the task list according to type of task followed by date and time.
- Within each type of task, it will sort in ascending order
Searches for tasks using a keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:

<fx:root alignment="TOP_RIGHT" maxHeight="1.7976931348623157E308" maxWidth="1.7976931348623157E308" minHeight="-Infinity" minWidth="-Infinity" prefWidth="600.0" type="javafx.scene.layout.HBox" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/18" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1">
<Label fx:id="dialog" alignment="CENTER" minHeight="99.0" minWidth="200.0" style="-fx-background-color: #e7e1f5; -fx-background-radius: 8;" text="Label" wrapText="true">

<AnchorPane maxHeight="-Infinity" maxWidth="-Infinity" minHeight="-Infinity" minWidth="-Infinity" prefHeight="600.0" prefWidth="600.0" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/18" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1" fx:controller="duke.MainWindow">

<TextField fx:id="userInput" layoutY="558.0" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="450.0" style="-fx-background-radius: 10;" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="5.0" AnchorPane.leftAnchor="2.5" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="147.5" />

<Button fx:id="sendButton" layoutX="457.0" layoutY="558.0" mnemonicParsing="false" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="141.0" style="-fx-background-color: #b8b1d3; -fx-background-radius: 10;" text="SEND" textAlignment="CENTER" textFill="WHITE" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="5.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="2.0">

<ScrollPane fx:id="scrollPane" hbarPolicy="NEVER" hvalue="1.0" prefHeight="550.0" prefWidth="400.0" style="-fx-background-color: white;" vvalue="1.0" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="50.0" AnchorPane.leftAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.topAnchor="0.0">
assertEquals("[D][ ] deadline task (by: 10 Oct 2022)", new Deadline("deadline task", "2022-10-10").toString());
assertEquals("D | 0 | deadline task | 2022-10-10", new Deadline("deadline task", "2022-10-10").toMemoryString());
assertEquals("[E][ ] event task (at: 10 Oct 2022 2.00pm", new Event("event task", "2022-10-10 1400").toString());
assertEquals("E | 0 | event task | 2022-10-10 1500", new Event("event task", "2022-10-10 1500").toMemoryString());
assertEquals("[T][ ] todo task", new ToDos("todo task").toString());
assertEquals("T | 0 | todo task", new ToDos("todo task").toMemoryString());
